creator: allcoms@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 33768
Centos 6 apr-util rpmbuild error log

I am trying to build an RPM of apr-util-1.5.4 using rpmbuild under CentOS 6.7 x64. I have the mysql dev package (and all other required deps) installed and it seems to me that the apr-util configure script detects the mysql headers yet apr_dbd_mysql.so doesn't get built and so the rpmbuild process fails with the error:

File not found by glob: /root/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/apr-util-1.5.4-1.x86_64/usr/lib64/apr-util-1/apr_dbd_mysql*

I have tried building an RPM of every apr-util with every version between 1.4.1 and 1.5.4 as root and as a normal user but they all fail with this same error.

I have attached the rpmbuild output.

Thanks

creator: ohauer@gmx.de
text:
Ha Dan,

have you tried to specify the include and mysql lib path?

E.g on FreeBSD the APU configure env is constructed like the sample snippet (APU configure environment)

ac_cv_path_PGSQL_CONFIG="" CONFIG_SHELL=/bin/sh CONFIG_SITE=/usr/ports/Templates/config.site HOME=/usr/ports/devel/apr1/work SHELL=/bin/sh XDG_CONFIG_HOME=/usr/ports/devel/apr1/work XDG_DATA_HOME=/usr/ports/devel/apr1/work lt_cv_sys_max_cmd_len=262144 CC="cc" CFLAGS="-O2 -pipe  -DLIBICONV_PLUG -fstack-protector -DLDAP_DEPRECATED -fno-strict-aliasing" CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/ports/devel/apr1/work/apr-1.5.2/include -I/usr/local/include -I/usr/local/include/mysql -DHAVE_MYSQL_H -I/usr/local/include -DLIBICONV_PLUG -I/usr/local/include"

creator: ohauer@gmx.de
text:
(In reply to ohauer from comment #1)

sorry, the following part was missing from the sample:
